content.webTitle: Newcastle United v Bournemouth: match preview

fields.headline: Newcastle United v Bournemouth: match preview
fields.bodyText: It was a 3-1 home defeat by Eddie Howe’s Bournemouth in March 2016 that marked the end of Steve McClaren’s Newcastle tenure, prefacing his replacement by Rafael Benítez. Now the man in charge is Steve Bruce who, despite years at assorted clubs, has never faced Bournemouth as a manager. Whatever the result, Bruce is highly unlikely to be dismissed but will nonetheless be happy when the impending international break is over. “I shouldn’t say it but a lot of managers think ‘I have to get past the international breaks’,” he said. “In October and November some of us think we’ve got past that hurdle of getting the sack.” Louise Taylor Saturday 3pm Venue St James’ Park Last season Newcastle 2 Bournemouth 1 Referee Martin Atkinson This season G10 Y31 R1 3.2 cards/game Odds H 17-10 A 19-10 D 9-4 NEWCASTLE Subs from Darlow, Manquillo, Krafth, Dummett, Ki, Gayle, Carroll, Muto, M Longstaff, Atsu Doubtful None Injured Lejeuene (knee, 25 Nov), Schär (knee, 25 Nov), Ritchie (ankle, unknown) Suspended S Longstaff (second of three) Discipline Y18 R2 Form DLWLDW Leading scorer Shelvey 2 BOURNEMOUTH Subs from Boruc, Travers, Stacey, Ibe, Simpson, Francis, Kelly, Mepham, Gosling, Danjuma, Dobre, Solanke Doubtful None Injured Brooks (ankle, 23 Nov), Surman (knee, 23 Nov), Daniels (knee), Stanislas (knee, both unknown) Suspended Lerma (one match) Discipline Y24 R0 Form WDLDDW Leading scorer C Wilson 5
